title: Plate from the Catherine the Great Service
artistDisplayName:
Sèvres Porcelain Manufactory
French, founded 1740
Painted by Edmé-François Bouillat (French, 1758–1810), Pierre-Antoine Méreaud (French, active 1754–91), and Philippe Castel (French, active 1771–97)
Gilded by Etienne-Henry Le Guay (French, active 1748–49, 1751–96)
medium: Soft-paste porcelain, turquoise-blue ground, polychrome enamels, and gilding
creditLine: Art Institute of Chicago. Purchased with funds provided by Dorothy Hale Dunbar, Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Grober, Mr. and Mrs. Stanford D. Marks, Mrs. Eric Oldberg, Harry A. Root, Jr., and the Antiquarian Society through bequests of Lena Gilbert, Harriet Jones, Jessie Landon, Adelaide Ryerson, and the Margaret C. and James D. Vail Fund in memory of her mother, Margaret Arronet Corbin
